text: hey everybody thomas joseph here with
another kitchen conundrum today i'm
gonna show you some easy ways in which
you can embellish and decorate cakes
with five pastry tips i'm going to start
off with probably what most people want
to do they want to write happy birthday
on the top of their birthday cake a good
way to practice is to use a piece of
parchment take a little bit of frosting
and put it in the four corners of the
sheet tray here as it helps to secure
the parchment i'm going to start off
with the small round tip so using one
hand to guide the other one should be
pushing apply an even amount of pressure
it does take a little bit of practice
but the great thing about using
parchment is that you can scrape off
whatever you've done and you can always
add it back into your bachelor FASTA and
keep practicing until you get it down
dot the eye and there you go there's
happy birthday so now for some other
ways in which you can use this round tip
here I'm going to do a dot pattern here
which is basically just pushing little
dots like this you can also drag out the
dots a little bit creating little
teardrop shapes like this and you could
also make a swag border which is really
nice for a birthday cake so these are
some fun ways in which you can use a
round tip so now I'm going to use an
open star tip place it directly on the
surface squeeze out a little bit and
then pull up so they create these little
stars like this you can also squeeze out
and turn the tip and it makes more of a
swirled star you can also do rosettes
where you start in the middle and you
swirl around and then you can also
create a scalloped border by just piping
out a little bit and then coming back
down so pushing out pulling down pushing
out pulling down you can create more of
a shell shaped border by rotating the
bag clockwise so it's squeezed out and
take clockwise squeeze out rotate
clockwise and you create this little
shell like border so that is an open
star tip so now for a closed star tip
which is very similar to an open star
except you get a little bit more detail
this almost looks like a starfish or
something like that and also they make
really great rosettes as well so swirl
around you can see how this has a little
bit more texture to it and then for a
border of course you can do the
scalloped edge or you can do the show
easy right now the next one I love this
tip this is a standard leaf tip so you
want to make sure that you hold the tip
horizontal to your work surface apply
pressure release the pressure and pull
the tip away so pressure stop pull away
if you wanted a longer leaf push out
more frosting that creates a longer leaf
you can also make a border with this
standard leaf shape as well you just
kind of keep piping like this creating
it long ruffled leaf another way that
you can do a leaf border you can
actually go off from side to side so you
kind of do this zigzag pattern that
creates a leaf border the next tip is a
standard straight petal tip and this is
used to make petals for flowers take the
wide end of the tip facing down pipe out
frosting bring your tip forward and then
bring it back and that's how you create
a petal can also create a ruffled border
with this tip as well
hold it right against the surface of the
cake you pipe out frosting and you zig
zag the pastry bag and pull away
slightly as you do and it creates this
ruffled order now one other thing that
you can do with this is you can create
flowers or roses and what you are going
to need is a flower nail take a little
bit of frosting place that right on the
top here and a little piece of parchment
paper stick it right on the top now you
can just take off the coupler
and pipe out a little bit of buttercream
right in the center here I'm going to
balance it off to the side while I
reapply the tip and now starting again
with the wide end of the tip facing down
pipe out your frosting and turn the nail
using your other two fingers you create
these little petals or half circles so
keep going around and gradually you're
going to work your way down to the base
this is when you're going to angle your
bag down slightly and build up the
flower so there you go you have
something that looks like a beautiful
rose so now what you do with this is you
gently slide it off onto a cookie sheet
and this whole thing goes into the
freezer until it's set
so our buttercream decorations are out
of the freezer and this is a really easy
way to embellish your cupcakes so take
an offset spatula like this glide
underneath your decorations and all you
have to do now is gently apply them to
the top of your cupcakes now you can use
all the same shapes if you'd like you
